                                   Certificate Program     Advanced Certificates    Post-Baccalaureate Advanced Certificate in TESOL    This 15-point program is designed for those who are interested in teaching English abroad and who decide to choose a second career in teaching English as a second/foreign language, and those who either do not seek a master’s degree or are undecided about matriculating for a master’s degree. Course work includes foundation in methods, structure of American English, and internship.    A description of the curriculum may be found here .    Learn more about the application requirements for the post-baccalaureate advanced certificate program.    Post-Master’s Certificate of Advanced Study    The Advanced Certificate is for second language teachers, supervisors, teacher trainers, administrators, and materials developers who wish to continue their study of TESOL beyond the master's level. The 30-point program can also serve as a bridge between master's and doctoral study.    Students are required to take courses in teaching methodology, curriculum development, and research methods.    Learn more about the application requirements for the post-master's certificate of advanced study .    Gainful Employment Disclosure    Learn more about our graduation rates, the median debt of students who completed the program, and other important information .                                        Overview of Multilingual Multicultural Studies at NYU Steinhardt                           Teacher Education AT NYU STEINHARDT         TESOL    The programs in TESOL ( T eaching E nglish to S peakers of O ther L anguages) are designed to prepare teachers, researchers and curriculum developers in English as a second language at all levels. Including a substantial field-based component, our programs are based on communicative methods of second language acquisition and a reflective model of teaching which incorporate collaboration with colleagues, students, and community.    Our goal is to prepare professionals with a firm foundation in language, literacy, and applied linguistics along with an understanding of a range of second language teaching approaches that can be adjusted to suit the needs of different learner populations from diverse educational and ethnic backgrounds. The TESOL programs affirm the value of heritage languages and cultures and take an additive view of second language acquisition.    Post-Baccalaureate Advanced Certificate Program in TESOL    The post-baccalaureate advanced certificate is designed for students who are interested in teaching English abroad or choosing a second career in teaching English as a second/foreign language. It can be a bridge to the master's degree in TESOL.    For more information about the program, contact Shondel Nero .    Learn more about the application requirements for the post-baccalaureate advanced certificate program .    TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages), M.A.    The master's degree programs prepare teachers of English to non-English speakers. Students can choose between a 34-credit program designed for teaching college students, adults, and TESOL in an international setting, and a 44-credit program for K-12 teaching in the United States which can lead to New York state certification.    L earn more about the application requirements for the master of arts program without certification .    Learn more about the the application requirements for the master of arts program  with  certification .    Dual Certification: M.A. in Foreign Language Education (7-12) and TESOL (K-12)    This dual certification program enables students to learn to teach English as a second language (TESOL) and a target foreign language (French, Italian, Chinese, Japanese and Spanish) in grades 7-12. The program of study integrates second/foreign language pedagogy, linguistics, cross-cultural studies, and second language acquisition research.    Please note that we are not currently accepting applications for TESOL and the following foreign languages: German, Hebrew, Latin, or Russian, while these programs are under faculty review.    For more information about the program, contact Shondel Nero .    Learn more about the application requirements for the dual certification master of arts program .    Dual Certification: Joint M.A. in Teaching French or Spanish as a Foreign Language (7-12) and TESOL (K-12)    These unique transatlantic programs, offered jointly with NYU Paris and NYU Madrid through the respective foreign language departments in the Graduate School of Arts and Science, combine two semesters in Paris or Madrid and two semesters in New York City.    The programs lead to eligibility for dual certification in Teaching French or Spanish for grades 7-12 and in Teaching English as a Second Language for grades K-12 in New York State.    Learn more about the application requirements for the joint French master of arts program . Learn more about the application requirements for the joint Spanish master of arts program .    Post-M.A. Certificate in TESOL    The post-M.A. (sixth-year) advanced certificate in TESOL is for second language teachers, supervisors, teacher trainers, administrators, and materials developers who wish to continue their study of TESOL beyond the master's level. The 30-point program can also serve as a bridge between master's and doctoral study.    For more information, contact Miriam Eisenstein Ebsworth .    Learn more about the application requirements for the post-M.A. certificate program .    TESOL, Ph.D    The doctoral program in TESOL emphasizes research in second language acquisition and pedagogy in linguistically and socially diverse environments and communities. Courses focus on issues of acquisition and use of English as a second or foreign language including pedagogy and research, intercultural communication, alternative research methodologies, and educational foundations.    For more information, contact Miriam Eisenstein Ebsworth .    Learn more about the application requirements for the doctoral program .
